title: How to Make Fermented Plant Juice (Organic Fertilizer)

steps.title: Combine the raw materials (see Things You'll Need below) in a 1:1:1 ratio.
steps.content: Combine the raw materials (see Things You'll Need below) in a 1:1:1 ratio. Example: 1 kg. plant materials, 1 kg. brown sugar, 1 gallon (3.8 L) water. This can be reduced, just remember the ratio.

steps.title: Place the materials in a large water-proof container.
steps.content: Place the materials in a large water-proof container. Mix the materials together until the sugar is dissolved in water.

steps.title: Cover the container with a piece of cloth and secure with a rubber band.
steps.content: Cover the container with a piece of cloth and secure with a rubber band. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Place the container in a quiet, cool and shaded location (such as a garage).
steps.content: Place the container in a quiet, cool and shaded location (such as a garage). Make sure the container won't be disturbed. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Leave the container for about a week.
steps.content: Leave the container for about a week. Do not disturb or move it as much as possible. [3] X Research source A week later, you will notice molds growing on the surface. The liquid will have a sweet-sour smell. It may be disturbing but its worth it. It is a sign that beneficial bacteria has inhabited the liquid.

steps.title: Mix the liquid thoroughly with a stick.
steps.content: Mix the liquid thoroughly with a stick.

steps.title: Strain the liquid into a large plastic bottle, using a strainer.
steps.content: Strain the liquid into a large plastic bottle, using a strainer. Leave enough space for the bacteria to breathe. The solid materials can be placed into the compost pile, if you have. Otherwise, throw it in the trash. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Put the bottle cap loosely on to allow air to enter.
steps.content: Put the bottle cap loosely on to allow air to enter. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Place the bottle in a dark, protected area such as a garage.
steps.content: Place the bottle in a dark, protected area such as a garage.

steps.title: Application:
steps.content: Application: Mix 1 cup of the liquid to 1 gallon (3.8 L) of chemical-free water. It is best applied early in the morning or late afternoon. Use the diluted liquid to water the plants at their bases. For most plants, apply the diluted FPJ at least once a week.
